Had he lived to continue his mathematical work, one feels sure that his name would today be as well known as the mathematicians with whom he collaborated.

Nevertheless he should not be though of primarily as a technician, for with this ability he combined creative power of the first order. As he himself was wont to say, technique without 'rugger tactics' will not get one far, and these rugger tactics he practised to a degree that was characteristic of his forthright and vigorous nature.
